title: How to Make Cherry Ice Cream

steps.headline: Remove stones and purée the cherries.
steps.description: Carefully de-stone the cherries, taking care not to waste any of the fruit.

steps.headline: Place the pitted cherries into a blender or food processor and purée.
steps.description: Once you have prepared all of the cherries, purée them so that you are left with a smooth paste. Leave to one side.

steps.headline: Make a basic custard.
steps.description: Separate the eggs if not already done, keeping the yolks in a small bowl and discarding the whites. Whisk the yolks together until they are well beaten.

steps.headline: Mix the egg yolks in a saucepan with single cream and caster sugar.
steps.description: Heat on a medium heat, stirring frequently until all the sugar is dissolved and the mixture is almost at the boil.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat and pour into a cold bowl or jug.
Combine the fruit and the custard.
steps.description: Once the mixture is cool, stir in the puréed cherries thoroughly.

steps.headline: Transfer everything into your ice cream maker.
steps.description: Check your manufacturer's instructions but for this quantity, you will probably need to put the machine on for roughly 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Once the time is up and the ice cream has set, simply scoop and serve. Add some fresh cherries as garnishes if wished.

text: Remove stones and purée the cherries. Carefully de-stone the cherries, taking care not to waste any of the fruit. Place the pitted cherries into a blender or food processor and purée. Once you have prepared all of the cherries, purée them so that you are left with a smooth paste. Leave to one side. Make a basic custard. Separate the eggs if not already done, keeping the yolks in a small bowl and discarding the whites. Whisk the yolks together until they are well beaten. Mix the egg yolks in a saucepan with single cream and caster sugar. Heat on a medium heat, stirring frequently until all the sugar is dissolved and the mixture is almost at the boil. Remove from the heat and pour into a cold bowl or jug. Leave to cool fully. Combine the fruit and the custard. Once the mixture is cool, stir in the puréed cherries thoroughly. Transfer everything into your ice cream maker. Check your manufacturer's instructions but for this quantity, you will probably need to put the machine on for roughly 30 minutes. Serve. Once the time is up and the ice cream has set, simply scoop and serve. Add some fresh cherries as garnishes if wished.
